posts.post_content:
**Aaron's Random Card Comment of the Day #32, 11/9/10**   
   
Selecting alternate-art cards for Duel Decks can be tricky. Typically we want the chosen cards to be (a) desirable by players, (b) fit into the gameplay of the deck, and (c) in the case of Planeswalker-themed decks, be something the given Planeswalker would have in his or her arsenal of spells.
  
   
Mutilate is a good fit for [Liliana Vess](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana Vess) thematically, it was very popular, and it played well against Garruk's hordes of green creatures. A great choice!
  
   
This new art is a mirror to Carl Critchlow's *Odyssey* [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun) (although it is missing the cute little blue birds). That version of [Overrun](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Overrun) is featured in Garruk's deck for some cool symmetry.
  
   
I, for one, was glad to see Mutilate get new art, not because I found the *Torment* version too disturbing, but becasue the central figure in that piece looked like a theater major to me as opposed to someone Chai... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
Aaron's Random Card Comment of the Day #32, 11/9/10

Selecting alternate-art cards for Duel Decks can be tricky. Typically we want the chosen cards to be (a) desirable by players, (b) fit into the gameplay of the deck, and (c) in the case of Planeswalker-themed decks, be something the given Planeswalker would have in his or her arsenal of spells.

Mutilate is a good fit for Liliana Vess thematically, it was very popular, and it played well against Garruk's hordes of green creatures. A great choice!

This new art is a mirror to Carl Critchlow's Odyssey Overrun (although it is missing the cute little blue birds). That version of Overrun is featured in Garruk's deck for some cool symmetry.

I, for one, was glad to see Mutilate get new art, not because I found the Torment version too disturbing, but becasue the central figure in that piece looked like a theater major to me as opposed to someone Chai... (see all)

Posted By: EvilCleavage (8/23/2010 3:09:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
To the people comparing this to [Damnation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Damnation). This is possibly the best creature removal in the entire game, when used under the right conditions. And those conditions are simple: use Mono Black.
  
   
Mutilate outflanks every evasive ability in the game.
  
   
-Creatures with shroud: Mutilate does not target.
  
-Creatures with protection: Mutilate does not target.
  
-Creatures with Indestructable: Mutilate kills with -1/-1 counters.
  
   
If you're running mono black you ought to have at least 20 swamps in your deck. In the late game there isn't a creature in the game that can survive Mutilate. Follow it up with Lili's ultimate; or even hold back an [Undertaker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undertaker) and some creatures with Madness.
  
   
Love this card. 5 stars.
posts.html:
To the people comparing this to Damnation. This is possibly the best creature removal in the entire game, when used under the right conditions. And those conditions are simple: use Mono Black.

Mutilate outflanks every evasive ability in the game.

-Creatures with shroud: Mutilate does not target.
-Creatures with protection: Mutilate does not target.
-Creatures with Indestructable: Mutilate kills with -1/-1 counters.

If you're running mono black you ought to have at least 20 swamps in your deck. In the late game there isn't a creature in the game that can survive Mutilate. Follow it up with Lili's ultimate; or even hold back an Undertaker and some creatures with Madness.

Love this card. 5 stars.
